title: About Shib
shortie: Hi! I'm Shib and I'm a master of all things front of the front end!
description:
Hey, there!

I'm Shib and I'm a master of all things front of the front end!

I've been professionally designing and building pretty websites and apps for the past 15 years! I've worked solo, on teams, and lead teams as well!

On the design side I'm pretty great at UX/UI, wireframing, mockups, prototyping, and making things pretty! My design software of choice is currently Figma!

On the development side I'm fab at HTML, CSS (SCSS!), Javascript (and Typescript!). My framework of choice is Angular but for smaller sites nothing beats the speed and accessibility of vanilla everything (like this site!).

I'm currently building a game in Godot called Tea, Please!, which is funded by Screen Australia!

title: Tea, Please!
shortie: Solo developing a narrative game funded by Screen Australia
description:
Tea, Please!

A short story-driven game from solo developer Siobhan Willoughby that explores the contrast between the drudgery and noise of office life and the surprising happiness and peace gained through remote work during lockdown. This is expressed through handcrafted interactive life vignettes punctuated with the simple action of making tea.

Funded by Screen Australia

Designed with: Figma, Procreate

Built with: Godot

slides.alt: A slide showcasing the Tea, Please! game. There is a Tea, Please! heading written in red with a tea cup and a jug on either side of the heading. Underneath are 6 mobile phone screens showing 6 game screens. Two screens are comics and the rest show game play. These are the Begin screen, a mini-game called 'make 10', a mini game called 'fill the kettle', and a mini game called 'make tea'.

title: Journey Into
shortie: A web-based game providing unique and engaging educational journeys for students across Australia
description:
Journey Into

A web based game providing unique and engaging educational journeys for students across Australia.

I was brought on as one of the founding members of the Journey Into startup to design and build the Journey Into platform. I've created the brand identity, game UI and artwork, as well as architected and built the front end UI. The game is still in development and due to launch its beta phase in 2024.

Designed with: Figma

Built with: HTML, CSS, Typescript, Angular

title: Never Never Gin
description:
Never Never Gin Website

“Not only did Miroma Project Factory deliver a beautiful website, but a highly functional and customisable site, with a user experience that encourages discovery and exploration” - Never Never Distilling Co

Never Never Distilling Co wanted a new website to suit their growing brand and help aid discovery of their products.

I was tasked with designing a completely new website experience that took into account the UX pain points with their existing website and fixing them to create a seamless flow that allowed for discovery from landing to product purchase.

Designed with: Figma

slides.alt: A screenshot showing the Never Never Gin landing page with two call to action buttons - 'Shop' and 'Visit'.

A screenshot of the cocktail recipes page.

title: Liv App
shortie: An app to help people living with dementia to stay at home longer
description:
Liv the App

The LIV app helps people living with dementia to stay at home longer by providing information, resources, local services, social connections and a way to keep in touch - or reach out - to friends and family.

I was brought onto the project initially to overhaul the design / UX and develop a design system. I stayed on the project until completion, developing prototypes, listening to client / end user feedback to develop new design / solutions, as well as building out the web app.

Designed with: Figma

Built with: Angular

title: MyWay Employability
shortie: A platform for the autistic community to support and manage their transition into working life.
description:
myWAY Employability

myWAY Employability is a personalised digital platform built for members of the autistic community to use to support and manage their transition into working life.

I was the lead developer on the project, architecting and building the solution, and creating fun UI interactions in order to engage users.

Built with: HTML5, SCSS, Javascript, PHP, Drupal 8
